_header: Ever is the eye to the wood lay / Therein is that I love
_description: A proverbial saying, followed by miscellaneous lines and snatches, possibly verse, found in the Ancrene Riwle — couplets

BLCottCleoCVI.Transcription: Ach eauer is þe echse to þe ƿodelese& þe halde bucke climbeð þer uppe
BLCottCleoCVI.Note: Olim f. 38. Variant second line means this is not rhyming.

BLCottNeroAXIV.Transcription:
euer is ðe eie to ðe ƿude leieþerinne is þet
                    ich luuie
BLCottNeroAXIV.Note: One line only; written as prose.

TCD97.First Lines:
Euir is min eyein þe wode leieIn quam
                        delectantillic mea lumina spectant…
TCD97.Last Lines: …In te ducenteme lumina fixa uident te
